title: SEGUID: Checksums for Linear, Circular, Single- and Double-Stranded Biological Sequences
text: The SEquence Globally Unique IDentifier (SEGUID) checksum (Babnigg and Giometti 2006) was introduced to provide a stable, unifying key for the same sequence in different databases facilitating linking protein sequences across databases. SEGUID v2 (2024) extends the original SEGUID method to support also double-stranded sequences (e.g. DNA) and circular sequences (e.g. proteins and double-stranded DNA).

title: SEGUID: Checksums for Linear, Circular, Single- and Double-Stranded Biological Sequences
text:
Availability
Implementations of above SEGUID methods are currently available for Python and R;

Python: package sgeuid
R: package sgeuid

For now, you’ll find these at https://github.com/seguid/seguid.

title: SEGUID: Checksums for Linear, Circular, Single- and Double-Stranded Biological Sequences
text:
Quick examples

Python
>>> from seguid import *

>>> ldseguid("ATATGCC", "GGCATAT")
'ldseguid=UnHLvKWgR_kAuUDz5D5zDYcYA7g'

>>> cdseguid("TATGCCA", "TGGCATA")
'cdseguid=UnHLvKWgR_kAuUDz5D5zDYcYA7g'
$ python -m seguid --type=ldseguid <<< $'ATATGCC\nTATACGG'
ldseguid=UnHLvKWgR_kAuUDz5D5zDYcYA7g

$ python -m seguid --type=cdseguid <<< $'TATGCCA\nATACGGT'
cdseguid=UnHLvKWgR_kAuUDz5D5zDYcYA7g


R
> library(seguid)

> ldseguid("ATATGCC", "GGCATAT")
[1] "ldseguid=UnHLvKWgR_kAuUDz5D5zDYcYA7g"

> cdseguid("TATGCCA", "TGGCATA")
[1] "cdseguid=UnHLvKWgR_kAuUDz5D5zDYcYA7g"
$ Rscript -e seguid::seguid --type=ldseguid <<< $'ATATGCC\nTATACGG'
ldseguid=UnHLvKWgR_kAuUDz5D5zDYcYA7g

$ Rscript -e seguid::seguid --type=cdseguid <<< $'TATGCCA\nATACGGT'
cdseguid=UnHLvKWgR_kAuUDz5D5zDYcYA7g
